title: State plan for the development of intellectual disability services 1989-1992: a consumer's guide
creator_contributor_role: CSV Community Services Victoria, IDS Public Education Unit, production company
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Mentally handicapped
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Mentally handicapped - Care - Victoria
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Institutional care - Australia
description: A consumer's overview of the State Plan for the development of Intellectual Disability Services which aims to help intellectually disabled people make decisions about their future regarding accomodation, employment, education, family support, recreation, rights and respite care. Discusses funding, changes in institutional care, assistance provided by the Community Living Support Service and the role of public education.
